SPA chairman meets Syrian parliamentary delegation
articles.content:
SPA chairman meets Syrian parliamentary delegation 
    Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with a delegation of the Syria-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group led by Mohammed Ahmad Saad, secretary general of the People's Assembly and chief of the group, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall yesterday.
 Present there were Ryom Sun Gil, chairman of the C.C., the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea and chairman of the Korea-Syria Friendship Parliamentary Group, and other officials concerned and Haissam Saad, Syrian charge d'affaires ad interim in Pyongyang.

Talks between delegations of DPRK and Syrian parliamentary groups held
articles.content:
Talks between delegations of DPRK and Syrian parliamentary groups held
    Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of Friendship Parliamentary Groups of the DPRK and Syria were held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 At the talks both sides informed each other of the situation in their countries and exchanged views on the issue of developing friendly and cooperative relations between the two parliaments and a series of matters of mutual concern.    
 Present at the talks were Ryom Sun Gil, chairman of the C.C., General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea who is also chairman of the Korea-Syria Friendship Parliamentary Group, officials concerned, members of the delegation of the Syria-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group led by Mohammed Ahmad Saad, secretary general of the People's Assembly and chief of the group, and Haissam Saad, Syrian charge d'affires ad interim here.

articles.title: DPRK foreign minister Paek Nam Sun leaves for Russian Federation
articles.content:
DPRK foreign minister Paek Nam Sun leaves for Russian Federation
    Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, minister of foreign affairs of the DPRK, and his party left here today to visit the Russian Federation.
 They were seen off at the airport by Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of foreign affairs, and Andrei Karlov, Russian ambassador to the DPRK.
